title: Several spells of light showers expected today
byline: Several spells of light showers will occur in the Western, Sabaragamuwa and North-western provinces and in the Nuwara-Eliya, Kandy, Galle and Matara districts today (04), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Congress passes Trump’s ‘big, beautiful bill’ cutting taxes and spending
byline: The US Congress has passed Donald Trump’s sprawling tax and spending bill in a significant and hard-fought victory for the president and his domestic agenda.

title: Driver and conductor suspended after student falls from ‘Sisu Sariya’ bus
byline: The National Transport Commission (NTC) has stated that the investigation into the recent incident involving a student falling from the footboard of a ‘Sisu Sariya’ school bus revealed that the accident was caused by the careless and negligent behavior of both the driver and the conductor.

title: Acting IGP issues circular on recording statements from individuals
byline: The Attorney General informed the Supreme Court yesterday (July 4) that the Acting Inspector General of Police has issued a circular outlining the procedure by which individuals summoned to provide statements in connection with complaints must be informed of the contents of such complaints.

title: Former Minister S.M. Chandrasena arrested
byline: Former Minister S.M. Chandrasena was arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) a short while ago.

title: IMF says Sri Lanka’s GDP could fall by 1.5% from US tariffs
byline: Sri Lanka’s GDP could decline by up to 1.5 percent if the United States reinstates a 44 percent tariff on Sri Lankan exports and lowers tariffs on competitor trading partners, according to an IMF country report.

title: Russia becomes 1st country to recognise Taliban’s rule in Afghanistan
byline: Russia on Thursday became the first country to formally recognise the Taliban’s government in Afghanistan since it seized power in 2021, after Moscow removed the group from its list of outlawed organisations.

title: Three including DMT Deputy Commissioner granted bail
byline: Three suspects, including the Deputy Commissioner of the Narahenpita branch of the Department of Motor Traffic (DMT), have been released on bail following an order issued by Colombo Chief Magistrate Thanuja Lakmali Jayatunga.

title: Revised bus fares from today; Hotline for public complaints
byline: The National Transport Commission (NTC) has announced that the annual bus fare revision will come into effect from today (04).

title: Trump eyes simple tariff rates over complex talks, says letters going out Friday
byline: President Donald Trump said Washington will start sending letters to countries on Friday specifying what tariff rates they will face on imports to the United States, a clear shift from earlier pledges to strike scores of individual deals.

title: ‘Superman’ returns to screens with ‘kindness, flying dogs and space battles’
byline: Donning the famous red cape for the first time in the new “Superman” movie gave actor David Corenswet a big confidence boost.

title: Kaduruwela Quazi Court judge and clerk arrested over bribe
byline: The Judge and a clerk of the Kaduruwela Quazi Court were arrested today (04) by officers of the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC).

title: Vocational education to be elevated as decisive subject in future – PM
byline: The Minister of Education, Higher Education, and Vocational Education, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya, stated that adequate attention has not been given to vocational education in Sri Lanka and that, however, necessary steps will be taken to position it as a decisive subject moving forward.

title: ‘Praja Shakthi’ national programme launched to eradicate poverty
byline: The ‘Praja Shakthi’ national programme, aimed at eradicating rural poverty and uplifting local communities, was officially launched on Friday (4) in a ceremony at Temple Trees in Colombo, under the patronage of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: UN records 613 killings in Gaza near humanitarian convoys and at aid distribution points run by US organization
byline: Israeli airstrikes killed 15 Palestinians in Gaza early on Friday, while a hospital said another 20 people died in shootings while waiting for aid.

title: Sri Lankan man arrested at Thai airport after 3 snakes found in his underwear
byline: A Sri Lankan man has been arrested at an airport in Thailand after allegedly trying to smuggle three snakes out of the country by concealing them in his underwear.

title: Former Minister S.M. Chandrasena remanded
byline: Former Minister S.M. Chandrasena, has been remanded until July 18 after being produced before the Colombo Chief Magistrate’s Court today (04), said Ada Derana reporter.

title: At least 25 people injured after gas station explodes in Rome
byline: A gas station explosion early on Friday in southeastern Rome injured at least 25 people including nine police officers and a firefighter, local authorities and rescuers said.

title: LIOC donates Rs. 100 million to President’s Fund
byline: The Lanka Indian Oil Company (LIOC) has donated Rs. 100 million to the President’s Fund, the President’s Media Division (PMD) reported.

title: Trump, Zelenskiy discuss weapons, escalating Russian strikes
byline: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said he discussed air defences in a conversation with U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday, and agreed to work on increasing Kyiv’s capability to “defend the sky” as Russian attacks escalate.

title: Economic growth holds no significance without reaching rural communities, says President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake emphasized that no matter the extent of economic growth reflected in statistics, if the advantages of this growth do not extend to the rural communities, then such growth holds no significance.

title: Kerala cannabis worth over Rs. 16 million seized in Mamunei
byline: About 71kg and 400g of Kerala cannabis have been seized in a coordinated search operation conducted by the Sri Lanka Navy and Police in Mamunei, Jaffna in the wee hours of today (04 Jul).
